Next Steps with Akuna Capital: HackerRank Coding Challenge

Hi Tri Cuong,Thank you for your interest in Akuna Capital! We're happy to move forward with the process for the Software Engineer Intern - Data Engineering, Summer 2025 role, which is an online coding assessment via the HackerRank platform. You should be receiving an email from HackerRank in the next day or so with the link to access the assessment. Please be sure to check your spam/junk folder as well as your inbox.HackerRank Test Instructions: This test will have the title "Akuna Capital Data Engineering Internship 2025 Coding Challenge 1." Please note that the test will need to be completed in Python, Java, or Scala and will remain open for 30 days from the date it is received. Once you begin the test, you will have 75 minutes to complete it. Directions will be available once you access the link. There will NOT be any extensions given, so be sure to note the deadline and do not open the test until you are able to take it uninterrupted.PLEASE NOTE: The content of this test is confidential and not to be shared externally.Akuna will NOT permit candidates to utilize ChatGPT or other AI tools to aid in the completion of any online assessments or interviews with Akuna, and doing so will result in disqualification.As a reminder, all of Akuna's interview questions are proprietary information. It is not acceptable to consult sources of any kind during this interview. By starting the HackerRank questions, you are acknowledging that the test is confidential and not to be shared externally (please note: this includes posting test questions and/or answers to websites such as Glassdoor).Good luck! We look forward to reviewing your submission and please be advised that it can take up to two weeks for us to get back to you with a result due to the high volume of candidates that we have in the process.To learn more about the interview process, please check out your interview Guide here ( https://app.guide.co/api/g-lookup?customerId=1f0c5f3c-3381-4a1d-82e8-79550c5a9aad&organizationId=d6a4c2cb-8b8c-4f8b-88a1-a5f3dbd3c750&atsApplicationId=375729853&atsCandidateId=349459822&fallbackUrl=akunacapital.com ). Hi Tri Cuong,We want to thank you for the time and effort you took to submit your application to the Software Engineer Internship (Summer 2025) role. We know that there are a lot of options out there and we are humbled that you want to contribute to the exciting projects going on here at Okta. In the spirit of transparency, we wanted to let you know that we have had a number of qualified applicants and we won't be able to continue with your candidacy at this time.You can also stay informed on the latest Okta news, events, and job opportunities by joining our Talent Community here ( https://talent.okta.com/Talent-Community-landing-page.html ). The Recruiting team at Okta wishes you the best in your search and we hope our paths cross again soon!*Please note that if you are in the interview process for a different position at Okta this message is only relevant to the role listed above.*Sincerely,The Okta Recruiting Team
Optiver: Dear Tri Cuong,We recently invited you to complete the Optiver assessment as the first stage in the recruitment process for the Software Engineer Intern (Summer 2025 - Chicago) role. However, we have noticed you have not yet completed the assessment in the given time frame. We will assume this means you are no longer interested in this role, but welcome you to continue the assessment from your originally provided link should this not be the case.If you opt to do this, you must email us at recruiting@optiver.us after you have completed the assessment to notify our team and continue with your application. Please do not re-apply to the role as we already have record of your application. If you completed a portion of the assessment, you can resume from the following section. However, if you started a section but did not complete it, we are unable to resend the assessment.If this is an error and you have already received an extension to complete the assessment, please reach out to us at recruiting@optiver.us only after you have finished your assessment.We wish you all the best in your future endeavors and remain open to the possibility of reconnecting with you down the line.Best,Optiver Recruitment

Hi Tri Cuong,Thanks again for expressing your interest in the Software Engineer Intern (Summer 2025 - Chicago) position at Optiver! We have reviewed your application and are excited to move forward with your candidacy.Below is an overview of our interview process, which typically spans 4 to 8 weeks, depending on availability.* Optiver Online Assessment* Behavioral Phone Interview with a recruiter* Virtual Technical Screen* Virtual Technical Interviews* Virtual Behavioral InterviewLet's get started:The first step in our interview process is the Optiver Online Assessment, which consists of three parts. The entire assessment takes approximately 3.5 hours to complete. You are allowed to take breaks between sections, but once you start a section, you must complete it without pausing.Within 48 hours, you will receive a separate email from the Optiver Assessment Platform (OAP) with detailed instructions and assessment links. Please complete the assessment within the next 15 days to ensure a smooth and efficient progression of your application. Failure to complete the assessment within the recommended timeframe may result in the discontinuation of your application.Due Date: 15 days from todayOnce you complete the assessment, we will follow up within two weeks to let you know if you qualify for the next round.Please keep the following in mind:* If you do not receive a separate email from OAP within an hour, check your spam folder. If it is not there, contact us at recruiting@optiver.us for assistance.* The use of AI assistance (ChatGPT, etc.) or online resources (Google, Stack Overflow, etc.) are not allowed for Optiver's assessments. This assessment is an approximation of later face-to-face interviews where you will be expected to solve problems in real time. If your assessment is flagged for plagiarism this may result in your application to Optiver being disqualified.* Assessments can only be completed once. If you have completed them in the last 8 months for a different role, Optiver location, or with a different email address, your application will be rejected.* Before starting your assessment, ensure you have read the directions and are in an optimal environment. We recommend using a laptop or desktop, as using an iPhone or iPad may affect how the assessment platform is displayed on your device. Requests to retake the assessment or any portion of it due to human error or environmental distractions will not be granted.Thanks again and good luck!On Behalf of Optiver US Recruitment( https://twitter.com/OptiverGlobal )130 E. Randolph Street | Suite 1400Chicago, IL 60601
Prepare for your interview with Optiver

Hi Tri Cuong,Exciting news! Your application has been received. As you get ready to embark on your candidate journey, wed like to share some information to help prepare you for the interview process.Below, youll find a knowledge hub that outlines important information from a typical day at Optiver to our vibrant company culture, what to expect during the interview process and highlights from our internship program. Dive into what makes Optiver a dynamic place to grow your career.What we doWant to learn more about what we do here? We are a proprietary trading firm, also known as a market maker.As a market maker, Optiver plays a vital role in financial markets by acting as both a buyer and a seller. We do not serve clients; instead, we trade using our own money and at the risk of the market. We help ensure liquidity by always being ready to buy or sell options that traders can immediately accept. We contribute to market stability by injecting liquidity and enabling smoother, more predictable trading outcomes.Learn more about the crucial role market makers like Optiver play in keeping markets stable and efficient through this video ( https://youtu.be/-3C8k4OwHfM?si=IRiNlhlXSY9woPji ).Behind the screens: Explore our teamsOptivers trading and engineering teams blend a passion for quantitative problem-solving with advanced technology to drive our business forward. Our traders are sharp decision-makers with an ownership mindset, managing their own books and teams to refine effective trading strategies continuously. Similarly, our engineers work alongside traders to develop innovative solutions that tackle complex challenges. This synergy across teams fosters continuous innovation, enabling us to push the boundaries of whats technologically possible in financial trading.Meet Rens ( https://youtu.be/HD8Z2iD5BGk?feature=shared ), a quantitative trader who shares what he enjoys most about working at Optiver.Meet Suganya ( https://youtu.be/59kTrpYY5NA?si=W6kRQ1AWxqKRc_xJ ), a software engineer turned tech lead, and hear about her journey.Culture: Collaboration is at our coreAt Optiver, collaboration is at the core of our culture. Our teams thrive on mutual learning and innovative problem-solving, leveraging the diverse strengths each member brings to the table. Whether you have one year or five years of experience, the best idea always wins. This approach drives our success and fosters a dynamic, forward-thinking environment.Hear more ( https://youtu.be/8eZXWt9d0-w?feature=shared ) about what makes Optiver a unique place to work.Discover our interview processStep 1 – Application: Submit your job application and information on our website.Step 2 – Assessments: Our assessments test various skills, including problem-solving and critical thinking.Step 3 – Interviews: A series of conversations where we will further assess your skills and give you the opportunity to learn more about the role.Our interview process is designed to be engaging and thorough, ensuring that candidates not only demonstrate their skills but also gauge cultural fit and potential growth within the company. This process can vary by role, but there are a few steps they all share in common.To learn more about our interview process, visit our campus FAQ page ( https://optiver.com/working-at-optiver/career-hub/us-campus-recruiting-faqs-2/ ).Unlock your career with Optivers internship programOptiver's internship program provides an immersive, dynamic introduction to the world of financial markets. It offers a deep dive into trading, technology, and research, empowering our interns to take ownership of impactful projects and collaborate with the industrys best and brightest. By the end of the program, our goal is to have identified future colleagues who will return to our world-class teams after graduating.To learn more, check out this blog post ( https://optiver.com/working-at-optiver/career-hub/internship-experience/ ) or watch this video ( https://youtu.be/IU66zuKduUA?feature=shared ).The ultimate learning experience: Global Optiver AcademyNo matter what team you join, your career at Optiver begins with comprehensive training. Our Global Optiver Academy program equips all graduate trading and technology hires with the knowledge needed to make an impact from the moment you join our team.To learn more, check out this blog post ( https://optiver.com/working-at-optiver/career-hub/discover-optiver-academy-execution-trader/ ) or watch this video ( https://youtu.be/ONPObMHh-k8?feature=shared ).On Behalf of Optiver US Recruitment( https://twitter.com/OptiverGlobal )130 E. Randolph Street | Suite 1400Chicago, IL 60601
U.S. Bank: Application received - your journey starts now

It's only just begunBy applying for an opportunity at U.S. Bank, you've taken the first step to jumpstart your career.       Learn about our hiring process      Tips to help you prepareA recruiter from our Early Careers team will reach out to you about next steps - please stay tuned to your inbox.While you're waiting to hear back from us, brush up on your interview skills.What can you expect during a phone screen?The recruiter will ask questions to verify your employment status, location, and salary expectations. They will also ask you to discuss your education and professional background as well as answer a few behavioral-based questions.Are you familiar with the EAR method?The EAR method is a great way to answer behavioral-based questions.Event - set the scene by describing the situation, challenge, or eventAction - explain the role you played and steps you took to overcome the challengeResult - share the outcome and what you achieved as a resultConsider asking questions to the recruiter.Determine what is truly important to you in a company. This could be questions about career development, benefits, company culture, and DEI. Also, if the recruiter doesn't bring it up, ask about next steps in the hiring process.Spotlight on early careersWhat advice you would give a current college student considering an opportunity at U.S. Bank?"Be authentic! U.S. Bank has an amazing team that serves as the backbone for the strong and rich culture it has."- Parus B., Investment ServicesWhat was one rewarding experience from the summer internship program?"One highlight from the Summer Internship Program was the weekly Learning With Leaders series. We were given the opportunity to hear directly from senior leaders, including CEO Andy Cecere and his direct reports, regarding their roles, group responsibilities, and goals for the future.They took questions, gave advice, and showed their support for the program. It meant a lot that they would take time out of their busy schedules to meet with us interns."- Sophia H., Investment ServicesResources for youCheck our events page for upcoming information sessions and career fairs. You can unsubscribe and stop receiving job alert emails at any time.U.S. Bank is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse workforce. Netflix: Complete Your Netflix Software Engineering Internship Application | Next Steps

Hi Tri Cuong,Thank you for your interest in our Netflix Software Engineering Internship role!In order for your application to be reviewed, please complete this Airtable form. Your application will only be considered complete after you submit this form in conjunction with the application you already submitted on our Netflix Careers site. Please only complete the form once; duplicate submissions will not be considered.Due to the large volume of applications we receive, we're sorry that we're unable to personally follow up with each applicant. Our full recruiting process may take several weeks, so we kindly ask for your patience as we complete candidate reviews and interviews. In order to maintain a fair and equitable hiring process, we will not be able to accommodate very tight deadlines.For applicants selected to proceed, the interview process will begin with a CodeSignal Assessment. The results from this assessment will be used as just one additional data point to determine who will be invited to the interview rounds. The first two rounds of interviews are technical/coding interviews with Netflix software engineers, and the final round consists of both technical and behavioral questions. Your advancement will be based on the feedback at each round.Important Note: If you're selected to move forward, the next email you receive will come from CodeSignal; we strongly recommend adding no-reply@codesignal.com to your contacts to prevent spam filtering.Our goal is to reach out to candidates who are chosen for initial next steps within the next two to three weeks. If you havent heard from us by then, we may have reached interview capacity.Note that our Software Engineering intern interview process is designed to assess your generalist skills, coding fundamentals, and aptitude. Offers will be extended to join our 2025 Intern class at Netflix, where well have 3 start date options in Summer 2025 to centralize onboarding programming and training.Thanks again, and good luck!-The Netflix Emerging Talent TeamPlease note that this email address is not monitored and replies to this message will not be read. optiver: Dear Tri Cuong,We would like to invite you to move forward with the next step of our hiring process by completing our online assessment.To ensure a timely and efficient evaluation of your application, please complete the assessment within 15 days. The full assessment will take approximately 3.5 hours to complete. We understand that this is a significant time commitment, so we recommend that you take breaks in between the sections to ensure that you are able to perform at your best. Please keep in mind that once you start a section, you must complete it in one sitting.Our assessment consists of three components, each of which will give us insight into your skills, abilities and aptitude. Please ensure you complete each component in order. Here is a brief overview of what you can expect:The assessments1Optiver - Campus Software Engineer Test 2024 - USThis portion is comprised of 2 coding questions. You are free to use the following languages: C#, C++, Java or Python. This component will take about 2 hours to complete.2Coding KnowledgeThis portion evaluates your programming and computer systems understanding. This component takes about 20 minutes to complete.3Zap-NThis assessment consists up to 9 short neuro assessment games. Each games lasts between 2 and 15 minutes. The assessment takes about 60 minutes to complete overall.Start assessmentsButton not working? Copy and paste this link into your browser: https://assessment-portal.optiver.com/Identity/Account/ConfirmEmail?userId=645d2fd1-20aa-41db-8f6d-b12189db47c2&&culture=en-usTo ensure an optimal experience, please follow these guidelines:Before starting your assessment, ensure you have read the directions and are in an optimal environment. Requests to retake the assessment or any portion of it due to human error or environmental distractions will not be granted.Make sure you have a stable internet connection. Please note that certain setups, such as VPN connections, may cause lags that can affect your performance during assessments.It is recommended to use a laptop or desktop computer, as using an iPhone or iPad may affect how the assessment platform is displayed on your device.Ensure that you have installed the latest version of Google Chrome, Edge, Safari or Firefox.Find a quiet environment where you can concentrate without any disturbances.Other important information:If you have applied to multiple roles with Optiver, you may have received multiple invites to take the Optiver assessment. Please note, you may only take each assessment once.Please note, it can take the system up to 10 minutes to sync that you have completed an assessment before continuing with the next required assessment. If you continue to see issues and are unable to continue taking the remaining assessments, please reach out to recruiting@optiver.us.The use of AI assistance (ChatGPT, etc.) or online resources (Google, Stack Overflow, etc.) are not allowed for Optiver's assessments. This assessment is an approximation of later face-to-face interviews where you will be expected to solve problems in real time. If your assessment is flagged for plagiarism this may result in your application to Optiver being disqualified.To begin the assessment, simply click on the 'Start assessment' button. Remember, you can take breaks between sections if needed butonce you start a section, you must complete it in one sitting.Please note that this email address is not monitored, and replies will not be read.If you have any questions, please reach out to recruiting@optiver.us.Best,Optiver Recruitment

SimplifySimplify: 👀 Get your resume fixed by a recruiter!

Hey Tri Cuong,Michael from Simplify here again – how has Simplify been for you so far? If you're actively job searching, I wanted to quicklyshare something exciting we've been working on – a personalized resume review service.When you book a session, we'll match you with an experienced recruiter specializing in the role you're looking for. UDX: Dear Cuong,You started a job application for the Internship – Data Science, Global Product and Pricing (Spring 2025) position on Jun 23, 2024. As a reminder, this job application is currently incomplete. To access your account please Click Here and select the ‘Complete Application option. Alternatively, if you do not wish to complete your job application, you can withdraw your application from our system and using the 'Withdraw Application' capability. We wish you the best in your career search and thank you for considering Universal Orlando Resort as a prospective employer.Sincerely,Talent Acquisition Universal Orlando Resort----------------------------------------------------------  Internship – Data Science, Global Product and Pricing (Spring 2025)Universal Destinations & Experiences Internship Program:Applications Close: June 28th, 2024, at 11:55PM ET. Submit your application as soon as possible – dont delay!Spring 2025 Program Dates: Approximately January 2025 – April 2025JOB SUMMARY:The Data Scientist Intern will be part of UDX's Global Product and Pricing team. The intern will train under the guidance of a data scientist in price optimization for admissions. The intern will learn end-to-end (systems, models, processes, and business) how admission prices are optimally generated and implemented.MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES:Learns the process, systems, models, and business rules in the optimization of admissions pricing at Universal Destinations & Experiences.Prototypes models for forecasting demand and optimizing prices of admissions.Creates forecasting models at the optimal level of disaggregation and fine-tunes regressors/parameters for optimal accuracy.Creates optimization models in dynamic programming and fine-tunes parameters for generating actionable price recommendations.Conducts data analysis and identifies pricing strategies to generate incremental revenue.Constructs hypotheses to test pricing strategies and implements, measures, and reports on pricing tests.Practices programming skills in Python, SQL; working with Tensorflow, Prophet, SciPy, NumPy libraries; working in AWS, Snowflake.As-Is and To-Be process mapping and analysisUnderstands and actively participates in Environmental, Health & Safety responsibilities by following established UO policy, procedures, training, and Team Member involvement activities.Performs other duties as assigned.EDUCATION:In pursuit of an Graduate degree at an Accredited Institution.Recent graduates will not be eligible for this program.Minimum cumulative 2.8 GPA is required.An official transcript may be required upon request.Preferred majors include: Statistics, Operations Research, Data Science.Preferred completed coursework:Linear ProgrammingMixed-Integer ProgrammingProbabilityStatisticsMachine LearningADDITIONAL INFORMATION:Preferable skills for success in role include but not limited to:Excellent modeling skills in forecasting and optimization preferred.Preferred familiarity with Revenue Management, Dynamic Programming, Price Elasticity of Demand, Tensorflow, Prophet, SciPy, NumPy, AWS, Snowflake, PowerBI, and Excel.Must be efficient in Microsoft Office Programs including, but not limited to: Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.Strong interpersonal skills, problem-solving abilities and organization.Exceptional attention to detail.Superior written & verbal communication skills.Work in a fast-paced environment and adhere to deadlines.Ability to work autonomously and/or in teams.Consistent attendance.Please note the following:This internship will be a hybrid experience, based in our Orlando offices.Interns must be currently pursuing a degree at an accredited university, and must have a graduation date later than April 2025.Universal Orlando does not provide housing. Interns are responsible for their own housing and transportation.In addition to all of our internships being paid, you may be eligible for financial assistance towards housing if applicable. Specific details about eligibility would be provided at the time of offer.Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.Universal is not accepting unsolicited assistance from search firms for this employment opportunity. All resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at Universal Orlando via-email, the Internet or in any form and/or method without a valid written Statement of Work in place for this position from Universal Orlando HR/Recruitment will be deemed the sole property of Universal Orlando. No fee will be paid in the event the candidate is hired by Universal Orlando as a result of the referral or through other means.Universal Orlando Resort.
